Posts.Content: Nov 16, 2013 08:42AM - edited Nov 21, 2013 01:05AM by Lms0139 My surgery was November 4th (BMX w/ TE). Sent home 11/5/13 with scripts for Tylenol 3, Cephalaxin and Doc-Q-lace. Had to take 2 T3 every 4 hrs along with the Doc-Q-lace. Got constipated and quite sick. Cut back the pain meds to 1 / hr and switched to OTC Dulcolax (after using suppositories to clear everything up). Drains were out at 8 days and after they were removed I've had fluid retention across my chest and under my arms! I HATE this! I sit around with two small pillows under my arms. My BMX surgeon injected the blue dye into my nipple to more quickly locate lymph nodes which left a dark blue scar which may need to be removed next week......this sucks! I feel so tight! I find myself getting panicky and need to remind myself that it only been 11 days post op. No longer taking pain meds except Extra Strength Tylenol as needed. I take a mild Xanax on occasion at night, (most nights), to get a decent amount of sleep. I don't want to become dependent, but I get anxious if I don't and I'm up off and on throughout the night. Thanks for letting me vent! I hate sitting around doing nothing! However, I'd like to add that I realize that I am in a far better situation than some of my BC sisters. My love and best wishes go out to you for your journey! UPDATE: another surgery scheduled! Infection started 1 day after I finished my 10 day course of antibiotics. PS called in a new Rx for Bactrim on Saturday and he saw me in his office on Sunday, removed 50cc fluid (looked the same as what came out in drains). Went back to PS on Tueday, PS scheduled surgery for tomorrow. Won't know the outcome until he gets in there and see where the infection is. Also, there is a LOT of the SNB blue dye still in the tissue of the breast that has to be removed.

Posts.Content: Dec 18, 2013 11:12AM Lms0139 wrote: My infection is finally subsiding; however, I've been advised that there will be an ongoing possibility of recurrence on my left side.  I have been advised (but had already decided) not to try again for implants as I will have many problems with infections in the future.  He, my infectious disease doctor, recommended against reconstructive surgery also since I would again face issues with infection.  I've had 4 surgeries on my left breast side, 2 in 2005 for my first diagnosis and 2 this year for my 2nd diagnosis, plus radiation in 2005 also damaged tissue.  Oh well!  I'm not even upset about it since I hate the way the TE feels.  Can't wait to have the one on the right side removed!  Feeling better and looking forward to getting back to life!  There are a lot of nice bathing suits, bras and camisoles for prostheses.
